sailpoint.workflow
Class AbstractWorkflowHandler

java.lang.Object
  sailpoint.workflow.AbstractWorkflowHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
WorkItemHandler, WorkflowHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
StandardWorkflowHandler
public class AbstractWorkflowHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements WorkflowHandler

Skeleton implementation of the WorkflowHandler class. Extend this when implementing a custom WorkflowHandler since you do not usually want to implement all of the callbacks.

                             WorkItem item)

Called by the system before a work item is about to be stored. This can throw validation exceptions.

handleWorkItem

public void handleWorkItem(SailPointContext con,
                           WorkItem item,
                           boolean foreground)
                    throws GeneralException
No-op by default. Override to provide custom behavior.

Called by the system after a modification to the work item has been stored. Foreground should be true if this is a UI request thread or any other thread that does not want to give up control for an indefinite period of time wile the case advances. Usually the advance is fast, but you cannot assume that.

Specified by:
handleWorkItem in interface WorkItemHandler
Throws:
GeneralException

startWorkflow

public void startWorkflow(WorkflowContext wfc)
                   throws GeneralException
Prints trace information to stdout if trace is enabled. Extend to add custom behavior.

Called when the WorkflowCase starts. Possible use as a hook to setup workflow variables.

Specified by:
startWorkflow in interface WorkflowHandler
Throws:
GeneralException

endWorkflow

public void endWorkflow(WorkflowContext wfc)
                 throws GeneralException
Prints trace information to stdout if trace is enabled. Extend to add custom behavior.

Called when the WorkflowCase completes. Possible use as a hook to take action on what happened in the workflow, though you could use a final Step for the same purpose.

Specified by:
endWorkflow in interface WorkflowHandler
Throws:
GeneralException

backgroundStep

public void backgroundStep(WorkflowContext wfc)
                    throws GeneralException
Prints trace information to stdout if trace is enabled. Extend to add custom behavior.

Called if we reach a step that forces the workflow case into the background. The step has not been officially started yet, it will be advanced when the case resumes in another thread.

Specified by:
backgroundStep in interface WorkflowHandler
Throws:
GeneralException

endStep

             throws GeneralException
Prints trace information to stdout if trace is enabled. Extend to add custom behavior.

Called as each Step completes. WorkflowContext will have the Step that has just completed.

GeneralException

startApproval

public void startApproval(WorkflowContext wfc)
                   throws GeneralException
Prints trace information to stdout if trace is enabled. Extend to add custom behavior.

Called as each Approval starts. WorkflowContext will have the Approval about to start. The owner expressions have already been evaluated and the Approval hierarchy has been refactored if necessary. If this is a leaf Approval, the WorkItem has not yet been generated.

Specified by:
startApproval in interface WorkflowHandler
Throws:
GeneralException

openWorkItem

public void openWorkItem(WorkflowContext wfc)
                  throws GeneralException
Prints trace information to stdout if trace is enabled. Extend to add custom behavior.

Called immediately before a WorkItem is about to be opened. The item will be set in the workflowContext.

Specified by:
openWorkItem in interface WorkflowHandler
Throws:
GeneralException

validateWorkItem

public void validateWorkItem(WorkflowContext wfc)
                      throws GeneralException
No-op by default. Override to provide custom behavior.

Called before a WorkItem is assimilated. If you throw, control will normally return to the UI and display the error message.

Specified by:
validateWorkItem in interface WorkflowHandler
Throws:
GeneralException

assimilateWorkItem

public void assimilateWorkItem(WorkflowContext wfc)
                        throws GeneralException
Prints trace information to stdout if trace is enabled. Extend to add custom behavior.

Called after a WorkItem has been assimilated and before we start advancing the steps. This provides a hook to do more complex transformation of the work item variables back into workflow variables.

Specified by:
assimilateWorkItem in interface WorkflowHandler
Throws:
GeneralException

archiveWorkItem

public void archiveWorkItem(WorkflowContext wfc)
                     throws GeneralException
Prints trace information to stdout if trace is enabled. Extend to add custom behavior.

Called when a work item is archived. The archive has been created but has not yet been committed.

Specified by:
archiveWorkItem in interface WorkflowHandler
Throws:
GeneralException

endApproval

public void endApproval(WorkflowContext wfc)
                 throws GeneralException
Prints trace information to stdout if trace is enabled. Extend to add custom behavior.

Called as each Approval completes. WorkflowContext will have the Approval that has just completed. This is perhaps the most useful callback, it can be used with the "poll" modes to take incremental action as approvals are approved or rejected.

Specified by:
endApproval in interface WorkflowHandler
Throws:
GeneralException

cancelApproval

public void cancelApproval(WorkflowContext wfc)
                    throws GeneralException
Prints trace information to stdout if trace is enabled. Extend to add custom behavior.

Called when a leaf approval is canceled due to a peer approval being rejecting in consensus mode. You might use this to send a notification.

Specified by:
cancelApproval in interface WorkflowHandler
Throws:
GeneralException

Print the given object to stdout. Note: This is primarily used by test classes. Consider WorkflowContext.trace(String) instead

getStringList

protected static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getStringList(java.lang.Object value)
Coerce the given value into a list of strings. The value of the selections argument can be one of: - String - List Further, each String can be a CSV.

Ignore design notes (see ExcludeDoclet)
Created for the ARG_SELECTIONS argument used with remediateViolation but relatively general. Items returned by getRemediatables will be CSVs, and since you can select both left and right sides the selection may be a List of CSVs. We need to flatten all this into a list of role names for remediation.
